```{r, echo = FALSE}
# glm

glm_reg = function(y,x,data){
  glm(formula=reformulate(termlabels = x, response= y), data=data, family = binomial(logit))

}

glm_m = function(y,x,data){
  base = c("age","sexe","niveau_etude_reg","mmse","ch","dia","hta_med","imc_reg")
  x = c(base,x)
  n0 = length(base)
  n1 = length(x)-n0
  mod = glm_reg(y,x,data)
  inf = length(mod$coefficients)-n1+1
  sup = length(mod$coefficients)
  coef(summary(mod))[inf:sup,]
  coef_table = round(coef(summary(mod))[inf:sup,c(1,4)],3)
  
  coef_table[1] <- round(exp(coef_table[1]),2)

  
  if(n1 == 1){
    names(coef_table) <- c("Odds Ratio", "p-value")
  }else{
    colnames(coef_table) <- c("Odd Ratio", "p-value")
  }
  
  return(coef_table)
}

```

```{r, echo = FALSE}
# lm

lm_reg = function(y,x,data){
  lm(formula=reformulate(termlabels = x, response= y), data=data)

}

lm_m = function(y,x,data){
  base = c("age","sexe","niveau_etude_reg","mmse","ch","dia","hta_med","imc_reg")
  x = c(base,x)
  n0 = length(base)
  n1 = length(x)-n0
  mod = lm_reg(y,x,data)
  inf = length(mod$coefficients)-n1+1
  sup = length(mod$coefficients)
  coef(summary(mod))[inf:sup,]
  coef_table = round(coef(summary(mod))[inf:sup,c(1,4)],3)
  
  return(coef_table)
}

```

```{r,echo=FALSE,warning = FALSE,message=FALSE}
## Fonction "outlier_hampel"

outlier_hampel = function(d){
  k = 3
  
  binf <- median(d,na.rm = TRUE) - k * mad(d,na.rm = TRUE) 
  bsup = median(d,na.rm = TRUE) + k * mad(d,na.rm = TRUE) 
  
  outlier <- which(d < binf | d > bsup)
  
  for (i in outlier){
    d[i] = NA
  }
  return(d)
}

    }
  }

mmse = 0
mmse_last = 0
mmse_diff = 0
mmse_avant_pl = 0
mmse_apres_pl = 0

for (i in 1:nrow(data)){
  li = c()
    for (j in 1:length(L)){
      li[j] = difftime(as.Date(data[i,L[j]],format = "%d/%m/%Y"),data$datepl[i],units = "days")
      
    }
  if (sum(is.na(li)) < 20){
    mmse[i] = data[i,paste0("score_mms",which.min(abs(li)))]
  
  cond <- sapply(li, function(x) is.na(x) == F)
  li = li[cond]
  
  mx = which.max(li)
  mn = which.min(li)
  
  mmse_last[i] = li[mx]
  mmse_diff[i] = abs(li[mn]) + abs(li[mx])
  
  inf <- sapply(li, function(x) x < 0)
  mmse_avant_pl[i] = length(li[inf])
  
  
  sup <- sapply(li, function(x) x > 0)
  mmse_apres_pl[i] = length(li[sup])
  }
}

    ptaut[i] = "ptau elevé"

    
  }else if (data$datepl[i] >= as.Date("24/05/2018",format = "%d/%m/%Y") & data$ptau[i] > 22 & is.na(data$ptau[i]) == FALSE){
      ptaut[i] = "ptau elevé"

      
  }else{
    ptaut[i] = "ptau normal"
  }
}

data = cbind(data,ptaut)
data = data %>% group_by(date_interval) %>% mutate(ptau = scale(log(ptau))) %>% ungroup()

data$folates = as.numeric(data$folates)
data$vitamine_b12 = as.numeric(data$vitamine_b12)
data$vitamine_d = as.numeric(data$vitamine_d)
data$proteines = as.numeric(data$proteines)
data$tsh = as.numeric(data$tsh)
data$uree = as.numeric(data$uree)
data$creatinine = as.numeric(data$creatinine)
data$calcium = as.numeric(data$calcium)


data$presence_biomarqueur = 0
data = data %>% mutate(presence_biomarqueur = replace(presence_biomarqueur,is.na(glucose_jeun) == F | is.na(cholesterol_total) == F | is.na(triglycerides) == F,1))


data$ptaut2 <- FALSE
data$ptaut2[data$ptaut == "ptau elevé"] <- TRUE

```


```{r, echo = FALSE}
data$apoe.reg3[data$apoe.reg2 == 0] = 0
data$apoe.reg3[data$apoe.reg2 == 1] = 1
data$apoe.reg3[data$apoe.reg2 == 2] = 1

data$ma2 <- FALSE
data$ma2[data$diagnostic_cli == 1] <- 1
data$ma2[data$diagnostic_cli == 2] <- 2


data$ma4[data$diagnostic_cli == 1] = 1
data$ma4[data$diagnostic_cli > 1] = 0

data$ma = data$ma4


data$groupe[data$diagnostic_cli == 1] <- 1
data$groupe[data$diagnostic_cli == 2] <- 2
data$groupe[data$diagnostic_cli == 3] <- 3
data$groupe[data$diagnostic_cli > 3] <- 4


data$abeta42t2[data$abeta42t == "abeta42 faible"] <- TRUE
data$abeta42t2[data$abeta42t == "abeta42 normal"] <- FALSE
data$abeta42t2[is.na(data$abeta42t)] <- NA
```


# Objectif

Trouver d'éventuelles associations en les marqueurs de la maladie d'Alzheimer et le Cholesterol (total, HDL et LDL)  
<br>
Les valeurs du cholesterol sont standardisés  
Les valeurs de l'Abeta42 en continues sont standardisées sur leur logarithme et multiplié par -1  
Les valeurs de ptau en continues sont standardisées sur leur logarithme


# Etude d'association

## Abeta42 en dichotomique {.tabset}

### Modèle de base

Le modèle de base comporte les variables suivantes :  
- Age  
- Sexe  
- Niveau d'étude  
- MMSE  
- Les traitements  
- IMC  
- APOE  

```{r, echo = FALSE}
#data_chol abeta42 dichotomique

data_chol = filter(data, is.na(abeta42t2) == F,
               is.na(age) == F,
               is.na(sexe) == F,
               is.na(apoe.reg2) == F,
               is.na(mmse) == F,
               is.na(ch) == F,
               is.na(dia) == F,
               is.na(hta_med) == F,
               is.na(imc_reg) == F,
               is.na(presence_biomarqueur) == F,
               is.na(niveau_etude_reg) == F,
               is.na(ma) == F
               )

data_chol$cholesterol_total = scale(data_chol$cholesterol_total)
data_chol$cholesterol_hdl = scale(data_chol$cholesterol_hdl)
data_chol$cholesterol_ldl = scale(data_chol$cholesterol_ldl)

data_chol$sexe = as.factor(data_chol$sexe)
data_chol$ch = as.factor(data_chol$ch)
data_chol$dia = as.factor(data_chol$dia)
data_chol$hta_med = as.factor(data_chol$hta_med)
data_chol$apoe.reg2 = as.factor(data_chol$apoe.reg2)
data_chol$ma = as.factor(data_chol$ma)
data_chol$ma_mci = as.factor(data_chol$ma_mci)


data_ma_0 = data_chol %>% filter(ma == 0)
data_ma_1 = data_chol %>% filter(ma == 1)

data_mamci_0 = data_chol %>% filter(ma_mci == 0)
data_mamci_1 = data_chol %>% filter(ma_mci == 1)

data_apoe_0 = data_chol %>% filter(apoe.reg2 == 0)
data_apoe_1 = data_chol %>% filter(apoe.reg2 != 0)

data_ma2_0 = data_chol %>% filter(ma2 == 0)
data_ma2_1 = data_chol %>% filter(ma2 == 1)
data_ma2_2 = data_chol %>% filter(ma2 == 2)


data_groupe_1 = data_chol %>% filter(groupe == 1)
data_groupe_2 = data_chol %>% filter(groupe == 2)
data_groupe_3 = data_chol %>% filter(groupe == 3)
data_groupe_4 = data_chol %>% filter(groupe == 4)



```

```{r, echo = FALSE}
#data_chol abeta42 continue

data_chol = filter(data, is.na(abeta42t2) == F,
               is.na(age) == F,
               is.na(sexe) == F,
               is.na(apoe.reg2) == F,
               is.na(mmse) == F,
               is.na(ch) == F,
               is.na(dia) == F,
               is.na(hta_med) == F,
               is.na(imc_reg) == F,
               is.na(presence_biomarqueur) == F,
               is.na(niveau_etude_reg) == F,
               is.na(ma) == F
               )

data_chol$cholesterol_total = scale(data_chol$cholesterol_total)
data_chol$cholesterol_hdl = scale(data_chol$cholesterol_hdl)
data_chol$cholesterol_ldl = scale(data_chol$cholesterol_ldl)

data_chol$sexe = as.factor(data_chol$sexe)
data_chol$ch = as.factor(data_chol$ch)
data_chol$dia = as.factor(data_chol$dia)
data_chol$hta_med = as.factor(data_chol$hta_med)
data_chol$apoe.reg2 = as.factor(data_chol$apoe.reg2)
data_chol$ma = as.factor(data_chol$ma)
data_chol$ma_mci = as.factor(data_chol$ma_mci)


data_ma_0 = data_chol %>% filter(ma == 0)
data_ma_1 = data_chol %>% filter(ma == 1)

data_mamci_0 = data_chol %>% filter(ma_mci == 0)
data_mamci_1 = data_chol %>% filter(ma_mci == 1)

data_apoe_1 = data_chol %>% filter(apoe.reg2 != 0)

data_groupe_2 = data_chol %>% filter(groupe == 2)
```

## Ratio Abeta42/Abeta40 {.tabset}

### Modèle de base

Le modèle de base comporte les variables suivantes :  
- Age  
- Sexe  
- Niveau d'étude  
- MMSE  
- Les traitements  
- IMC  
- APOE  

```{r, echo = FALSE}
#data_chol ab42_ab40

data_chol = filter(data, is.na(ab42_ab40) == F,
               is.na(age) == F,
               is.na(sexe) == F,
               is.na(apoe.reg2) == F,
               is.na(mmse) == F,
               is.na(ch) == F,
               is.na(dia) == F,
               is.na(hta_med) == F,
               is.na(imc_reg) == F,
               is.na(presence_biomarqueur) == F,
               is.na(niveau_etude_reg) == F,
               is.na(ma) == F
               )

data_chol$cholesterol_total = scale(data_chol$cholesterol_total)
data_chol$cholesterol_hdl = scale(data_chol$cholesterol_hdl)
data_chol$cholesterol_ldl = scale(data_chol$cholesterol_ldl)

data_chol$sexe = as.factor(data_chol$sexe)
data_chol$ch = as.factor(data_chol$ch)
data_chol$dia = as.factor(data_chol$dia)
data_chol$hta_med = as.factor(data_chol$hta_med)
data_chol$apoe.reg2 = as.factor(data_chol$apoe.reg2)
data_chol$ma = as.factor(data_chol$ma)
data_chol$ma_mci = as.factor(data_chol$ma_mci)


data_ma_0 = data_chol %>% filter(ma == 0)
data_ma_1 = data_chol %>% filter(ma == 1)

data_mamci_0 = data_chol %>% filter(ma_mci == 0)
data_mamci_1 = data_chol %>% filter(ma_mci == 1)

data_apoe_0 = data_chol %>% filter(apoe.reg2 == 0)
data_apoe_1 = data_chol %>% filter(apoe.reg2 != 0)

data_ma2_0 = data_chol %>% filter(ma2 == 0)
data_ma2_1 = data_chol %>% filter(ma2 == 1)
data_ma2_2 = data_chol %>% filter(ma2 == 2)

data_groupe_1 = data_chol %>% filter(groupe == 1)
data_groupe_2 = data_chol %>% filter(groupe == 2)
data_groupe_3 = data_chol %>% filter(groupe == 3)
data_groupe_4 = data_chol %>% filter(groupe == 4)
```

## ptau en dichotomique {.tabset}

### Modèle de base

Le modèle de base comporte les variables suivantes :  
- Age  
- Sexe  
- Niveau d'étude  
- MMSE  
- Les traitements  
- IMC  
- APOE  

```{r, echo = FALSE}
#data_chol ptau dichotomique

data_chol = filter(data, is.na(ptaut2) == F,
               is.na(age) == F,
               is.na(sexe) == F,
               is.na(apoe.reg2) == F,
               is.na(mmse) == F,
               is.na(ch) == F,
               is.na(dia) == F,
               is.na(hta_med) == F,
               is.na(imc_reg) == F,
               is.na(presence_biomarqueur) == F,
               is.na(niveau_etude_reg) == F,
               is.na(ma) == F
               )

data_chol$cholesterol_total = scale(data_chol$cholesterol_total)
data_chol$cholesterol_hdl = scale(data_chol$cholesterol_hdl)
data_chol$cholesterol_ldl = scale(data_chol$cholesterol_ldl)

data_chol$sexe = as.factor(data_chol$sexe)
data_chol$ch = as.factor(data_chol$ch)
data_chol$dia = as.factor(data_chol$dia)
data_chol$hta_med = as.factor(data_chol$hta_med)
data_chol$apoe.reg2 = as.factor(data_chol$apoe.reg2)
data_chol$ma = as.factor(data_chol$ma)
data_chol$ma_mci = as.factor(data_chol$ma_mci)


data_ma_0 = data_chol %>% filter(ma == 0)
data_ma_1 = data_chol %>% filter(ma == 1)

data_mamci_0 = data_chol %>% filter(ma_mci == 0)
data_mamci_1 = data_chol %>% filter(ma_mci == 1)

data_apoe_0 = data_chol %>% filter(apoe.reg2 == 0)
data_apoe_1 = data_chol %>% filter(apoe.reg2 != 0)

data_ma2_0 = data_chol %>% filter(ma2 == 0)
data_ma2_1 = data_chol %>% filter(ma2 == 1)
data_ma2_2 = data_chol %>% filter(ma2 == 2)


data_groupe_1 = data_chol %>% filter(groupe == 1)
data_groupe_2 = data_chol %>% filter(groupe == 2)
data_groupe_3 = data_chol %>% filter(groupe == 3)
data_groupe_4 = data_chol %>% filter(groupe == 4)
```

```{r,echo=FALSE}
y = "ptaut2"
```

## ptau en continue {.tabset}

### Modèle de base

Le modèle de base comporte les variables suivantes :  
- Age  
- Sexe  
- Niveau d'étude  
- MMSE  
- Les traitements  
- IMC  
- APOE  

```{r, echo = FALSE}
#data_chol abeta42 continue

data_chol = filter(data, is.na(ptau) == F,
               is.na(age) == F,
               is.na(sexe) == F,
               is.na(apoe.reg2) == F,
               is.na(mmse) == F,
               is.na(ch) == F,
               is.na(dia) == F,
               is.na(hta_med) == F,
               is.na(imc_reg) == F,
               is.na(presence_biomarqueur) == F,
               is.na(niveau_etude_reg) == F,
               is.na(ma) == F
               )

data_chol$cholesterol_total = scale(data_chol$cholesterol_total)
data_chol$cholesterol_hdl = scale(data_chol$cholesterol_hdl)
data_chol$cholesterol_ldl = scale(data_chol$cholesterol_ldl)

data_chol$sexe = as.factor(data_chol$sexe)
data_chol$ch = as.factor(data_chol$ch)
data_chol$dia = as.factor(data_chol$dia)
data_chol$hta_med = as.factor(data_chol$hta_med)
data_chol$apoe.reg2 = as.factor(data_chol$apoe.reg2)
data_chol$ma = as.factor(data_chol$ma)
data_chol$ma_mci = as.factor(data_chol$ma_mci)


data_ma_0 = data_chol %>% filter(ma == 0)
data_ma_1 = data_chol %>% filter(ma == 1)

data_mamci_0 = data_chol %>% filter(ma_mci == 0)
data_mamci_1 = data_chol %>% filter(ma_mci == 1)

data_apoe_0 = data_chol %>% filter(apoe.reg2 == 0)
data_apoe_1 = data_chol %>% filter(apoe.reg2 != 0)

data_ma2_0 = data_chol %>% filter(ma2 == 0)
data_ma2_1 = data_chol %>% filter(ma2 == 1)
data_ma2_2 = data_chol %>% filter(ma2 == 2)

data_groupe_1 = data_chol %>% filter(groupe == 1)
data_groupe_2 = data_chol %>% filter(groupe == 2)
data_groupe_3 = data_chol %>% filter(groupe == 3)
data_groupe_4 = data_chol %>% filter(groupe == 4)
```

```{r,echo=FALSE}
y = "ptau"
```
